text.text_translated: "The Life of Pi" tells the extraordinary story of an Indian teenager named Pi, who becomes shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat on the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. The book, which was published in 2001, is the third one by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and since then it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes, and been translated into 41 languages. The author, Yann Martel, is the son of a diplomat, and as a result, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico when he was a child.

feedback.feedback: This is an excellent B1 submission. Your ability to construct long, complex sentences is a clear strength. For example, you correctly used a relative clause ('which was published in 2001') and a connector of result ('as a result') to link ideas smoothly and accurately. The vocabulary is appropriate for the level, and all facts from the original text have been preserved perfectly. This text fully demonstrates the B1 competence to write connected text.
